definitions.definition: Having no bottom.
Extremely deep.
Having no bounds; limitless.

definitions.definition: Difficult to understand; unfathomable.
Not wearing clothes below the waist; particularly not wearing clothes that would cover the genitalia.
A female pig.
A female bear, she-bear.
A female guinea pig.
A channel that conducts molten metal to molds.
A mass of metal solidified in a mold.
A contemptible, often fat woman.
A sowbug.
A kind of covered shed, formerly used by besiegers in filling up and passing the ditch of a besieged place, sapping and mining the wall, etc.
To scatter, disperse, or plant (seeds).

definitions.definition: To spread abroad; to propagate.
To scatter over; to besprinkle.
To ascribe (something) to a given cause, reason etc.
To associate ownership or authorship of (something) to someone.
definitions.example: This poem is attributed to Browning.

definitions.definition: A part of any device that functions in or near the mouth, especially:
A spokesman; one who speaks on behalf of someone else.
definitions.example: The novel's protagonist serves as a mouthpiece for the author's political views.

definitions.definition: A lawyer for the defense.
Something that encumbers; a burden that must be carried.
An interest, right, burden, or liability attached to a title of land, such as a lien or mortgage.
One who is dependent on another.

definitions.definition: Any of various edible fish, of the genus Tilapia, native to Africa and the Middle East but naturalized worldwide.
A device for holding one or more lit candles
A person who holds a candle to assist another person who is working in dim light.

To sing a lullaby to.
One who slashes.

A horror movie with graphic blood and violence. A slasher movie

A tool for cutting undergrowth.
One who writes slash fiction and/or supports male/male ships.
To review something.

A small protein containing up to 100 amino acids; see also oligopeptide.
A variety of shoe, typically made of heavy leather.
(by ellipsis) An Oxford Dictionary.
Causing great pain or anguish, agonizing
Exceedingly intense; extreme
A domestic cat breed with short legs.
The empty space in the center of a donut.
A small ball-shaped pastry, made in the same manner as a donut, roughly the size of the hole in a donut.

definitions.definition: (welfare) An income bracket where one is without benefits, even though benefits are available in the next lower and next higher brackets.

A child.
A person of very short stature.
A player who mainly concentrates on increasing their character's power and capabilities.
Prompt; on time.
Existing as a point or series of points
Expressing momentary action that has no duration

Observing trivial points; punctilious.

Any of a cassette tape, eight-track tape, reel-to-reel tape, DAT, etc.
To record onto audiotape.
In a retrospective manner.
A person or animal that runs away or has run away; a person, animal, or organization that escapes captivity or restrictions.

definitions.definition: A vehicle (especially, a train) that is out of control.
(usually attributive) An object or process that is out of control or out of equilibrium.
The act of running away, especially of a horse or teams.
An overwhelming victory.

definitions.definition: An inflammation of the conjunctiva, often due to infection.
Knowing, certain, sure, wis.
To speak at length on a trivial subject.
definitions.example: She got home and started wittering about some religious cult she’d just heard about.

definitions.definition: To make sure, inform, or declare.
To insert (a graft) in a branch or stem of another tree; to propagate by insertion in another stock; also, to insert a graft upon.
To insert scions (grafts) from one tree, or kind of tree, etc., into another; to practice grafting.
To implant a portion of (living flesh or akin) in a lesion so as to form an organic union.
To join (one thing) to another as if by grafting, so as to bring about a close union.

To work.
To obtain illegal gain from bribery or similar corrupt practices.
Any channel, either natural or artificial, through which water flows.
Hologram
(of a protein) Bound by ligands

definitions.definition: (sometimes figurative) To support or shore up something.

definitions.definition: To play rugby in the prop position
(usually with "up" - see prop up) To position the feet of (a person) while sitting, lying down, or reclining so that the knees are elevated at a higher level.
To manually start the engine of a propeller-driven aircraft with no electric starter by pulling vigorously on one of the propeller blades using the hands, so that the propeller can catch ignition.

To put at risk upon success in competition, or upon a future contingency.

A synthetic compound related to hydantoin, used as an anticonvulsant in the treatment of epilepsy.

Conversation
Susceptible to being tested.
With respect to the scientific method, capable of being proven true or false.
Capable of being devised, or given by will.

definitions.definition: To repeat or review work already done.

definitions.definition: To taxi down an active runway in the opposite direction to that being used for takeoff.

definitions.definition: To exercise a racehorse around the racetrack in the opposite direction to that in which races are run.

The usage of a runway as a taxiway, especially at private strips and smaller airports.
The act of building all possible solutions to a problem incrementally, abandoning any candidate solution if it cannot lead to a valid solution.
Having a derivative, said of a function whose domain and codomain are manifolds.
(of multiple items) able to be differentiated, e.g. because they appear different
A Central American plant, Agave sisalana, cultivated for its sword-shaped leaves that yield fibers used for rope.
The fibre of the plant.
A sisal mat.
A Mafia gangster.
Any organic compound having one or more carbon–carbon triple bonds; an alkyne.
Ethyne; the simplest alkyne, a hydrocarbon of formula HC≡CH. It is a colourless, odorless gas, formerly used as an illuminating gas, but now used in welding or metallurgy.
A lamp powered by acetylene, particularly a motor vehicle headlight.
An event resulting in great loss.
The distress that results from some disaster.
A desert-dweller, especially a member of a nomadic Arab desert tribe.
The imagination.
An image or representation of anything formed in the mind.
An opinion or notion formed without much reflection.
A whim.

definitions.definition: Love or amorous attachment.

definitions.definition: The object of inclination or liking.
Any sport or hobby pursued by a group.

definitions.definition: The enthusiasts of such a pursuit.
definitions.example: He fell out of favor with the boxing fancy after the incident.

definitions.definition: A diamond with a distinctive colour.
That which pleases or entertains the taste or caprice without much use or value.
A sort of love song or light impromptu ballad.
In the game of jacks, a style of play involving additional actions (contrasted with plainsies).

definitions.definition: Would like

definitions.definition: To be sexually attracted to.

definitions.definition: To imagine, suppose.

definitions.definition: To form a conception of; to portray in the mind.

To breed (animals) as a hobby.
An annoyance or grievance.

definitions.definition: One who accuses; one who brings a charge of crime or fault.
A polymer derived from more than one species of monomer.
A person who, although present at some event, does not take part in it; an observer or spectator.

A meaning of a word or phrase that is suggested or implied, as opposed to a denotation, or literal meaning. A characteristic of words or phrases, or of the contexts that words and phrases are used in.
The attribute or aggregate of attributes connoted by a term, contrasted with denotation.
definitions.example: The two expressions "the morning star" and "the evening star" have different connotations but the same denotation (i.e. the planet Venus).

definitions.definition: Able to be booked or reserved.

definitions.definition: To convey or transfer to another, as title, property, or right; to part voluntarily with ownership of.

Tending to alienate.

(Jungian psychology) The unconscious feminine aspect of a person.
To make normal, to make standard.

A variant of solitaire, played with two decks of cards.
A breed of chicken originating in Turkey, kept primarily in gardens for ornamental reasons. See: sultan (chicken)

A form of cribbage in which the first to score 121 (or 61) is the loser.
An unmixed alcohol drink served on ice or water in a short glass.

Not fertile.
